p: Mohammed El Said is a legal consultant and Professor in International Trade and Intellectual Property Law at the School of Justice, the University of Central Lancashire (UK). He worked as a resource person extensively with international organizations including the UNDP, WIPO, UNITAID and WHO in the field of IP policy, IP and development, public health and access to medicines. El Said has several books and publications in the area of intellectual property, public health and access to medicines. He is the author of WHO's policy guide entitled Public Health Related TRIPS-Plus Provisions in Bilateral Trade Agreements: A Policy Guide for Negotiations and Implementers in the Eastern Mediterranean Region, WHO-ICTSD, 2010.
